text: Curently using the HubSpot meeting embed link in a HubSpot page thats presented to a user after a redirect of a form fill. I have the users email and currently passing it through to the meeting link in the url parameters (email={{email}}). is there any way to bypass this "enter email address" since it is already known? I found a few HubSpot forum posts about it and haven't had much luck (<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Auto-populate-fields-on-meeting-booking-form/m-p/223864> for example)
Hey <@U01QUB1BU0P> , is this what you're talking about? <https://www.loom.com/share/8d753bc16f8b47ba88058192d556c527>

Almost. Although after browsing your link, yours doesnt appear to have the issue and is working like I want it to work. I'm using a roundrobin meeting link and getting presented with a "Let's meet...enter email address" prompt before the calendar:
<https://www.inboundignited.com/meetings/cj81/roundrobin-test>
It looks like its because I have the "prioritize contact owner" option selected in the round robin options. Looking for a way to pre-populate that prompt
Ah, interesting. Do you have this toggled?
Unfortunately I created a round robin meeting link but because I'm the only team member I think some of the functionality might be different
ahh, that seemed to do the trick, thanks so much.
if email is passed in the url, then it bypasses that initial screen
Very nice, that's kinda what I thought it would do
just a general fyi - if on the round robin you turn off the toggle to prioritize contact owner, it skips that page as well. not relevant for all use cases, but sometimes

Hi <@U25PYL3Q8> - there wasn't anything in the revision history, and I unfortunately did not preserve the original page. It had to do with a different user going in and connecting to HubDB rows. I logged in with those user permissions and couldn't replicate the issue, but it did happen twice.

Hi all, I’d like to know what the best way is to create a personal customer web page where customers can check their HubSpot deal property values.

So a page where customers :
• need to login (i know this is a feature in HubSpot)
• see their contact and /or deal properties (dont know how to do this, do we need the API for this?)
Could really use some pointers here! thanks
